events.title: Weather tracker: Spain and Portugal hit by third deadly storm in two weeks
events.description: Storm Marta sweeps Iberian peninsula just days after Storms Kristin and Leonardo brought deadly flooding and major damage Spain and Portugal have endured another storm over the weekend, just days after the deadly flooding and major damage caused by Storm Kristin and Storm Leonardo last week. Storm Marta passed over the Iberian peninsula on Saturday, bringing fresh torrential rain and killing two people. Storm Kristin killed at least five people after it made landfall on 28 January with Storm Leonardo claiming another victim last Wednesday . The outlook for this week is for more rain across Spain, Portugal and France, especially across north-west Portugal, where more than 100mm is possible during the first half of the week. Some of the heaviest of the rain will transfer to southern Italy and western parts of Greece and Turkey later in the week. Continue reading...

Hilmaâ€™s Network was formed by Mortlock to bring â€œLiberal-mindedâ€ women together and push the party to preselect more women. Mortlock has been a vocal advocate for modernisation in the Liberal party, including pushing for the party to support net zero targets, and was part of a small team who designed a plan for gender quotas in New South Wales preselections. I have decided the time has come for me to step down as executive director of Hilmaâ€™s Network and I have also relinquished my Liberal party membership. Due to recent events I have decided there are other ways I can support women and Australia. A reset on immigration is profoundly important. We want to see a lower number of people come to our country, but we also want to raise the standards. What that looks like, I wonâ€™t get into the details today. But I think all Australians know if you come here, coming to Australia, living in Australia is one of the greatest gifts that could ever be given to anybody. events.title: Alleged cat burglar arrested after priceless Egyptian artefacts taken in Queensland museum heist
events.description: Man charged after 2,600-year-old cat sculpture, mummy mask and necklace stolen from Caboolture museum Get our breaking news email , free app or daily news podcast Queensland police have arrested a man accused of staging a brazen cat burglary of priceless Egyptian artefacts from a museum in Caboolture, north of Brisbane. The man, 52, of no fixed address, was arrested on Russell Island in Moreton Bay on Saturday evening, after police allegedly found most of the stolen artefacts in a camper van parked at a ferry terminal. Continue reading...

events.title: Epstein files fallout takes down elite figures in Europe, while U.S. reckoning is muted
events.description: Unlike in Europe, officials in the U.S. with ties to Epstein have largely held their positions of power.

events.title: Bangladesh's first fair vote in years comes with a daunting to-do list
events.description: A landmark election in Bangladesh ended years of disputed polls, and now the winners face pressure to tackle corruption and a battered economy.

events.title: A London beat framed by colonial history
events.description: NPR's Lauren Frayer arrived in London after years in India, and she's been covering Britain with the legacy of empire in view.

events.title: France assembles magistrate team to examine 'Epstein files'
events.description: A team of magistrates will search the so-called "Epstein files" to identify any further possible offences. The case of French modelling agent Jean-Luc Brunel is to be thoroughly re-examined.

events.title: Cuba's annual cigar fair postponed amid US oil blockade
events.description: Cuba has been grappeling with worsening fuel shortages as the US prevents oil shipments to the island nation. Organizers did not immediately set a new date for the Habanos Festival.

events.title: As the telephone turns 150, are we hanging up on phone calls?
events.description: Today, 150 years after the invention of the telephone, it has never been easier to call someone. But in some ways, and for some people, picking up the phone is still a very hard thing to do.

events.title: AI-fueled chip shortage drives up smartphone prices
events.description: The era of cheap data storage is ending. Artificial intelligence is pushing chip prices higher and exacerbating supply shortages. Anyone buying a new smartphone in 2026 should brace for higher prices.

events.title: How serious is Venezuela about its amnesty law?
events.description: After interim leader Rodriguez announced an amnesty law last month, some political prisoners have been freed. But one has already been rearrested, and analysts say reforms must accompany the new law.

events.title: Does this chemical really make you fall in love?
events.description: For years, oxytocin was thought of as the love drug: enhancing trust and emotional connection. But the truth is more complex.

events.title: Why German building projects run over time and budget
events.description: In Germany, big construction projects often derail. Airports, train stations and concert halls are finished years late and billions over budget.

events.title: Rennes stun Ligue 1 leaders Paris Saint-Germain to end winless run
events.description: Rennes returned to winning ways in emphatic fashion on Friday, claiming a 3-1 win over Paris Saint-Germain and handing Lens the chance to reclaim top spot.

events.title: Epstein survivor says women who recruited her 'laughed' as she was sexually assaulted on jet
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein's trafficking ring extended all the way to Africa's southern coast - held together by the invisible chains of psychological bondage that kept his victims ensnared for years at a time.

events.title: Valentine's Day gift for Winter Olympians - more condoms
events.description: Winter Olympics athletes are getting a Valentine's Day gift from organisers - a promise of a renewed supply of free condoms.

events.title: Trump says Iran regime change would be the 'best thing that could happen'
events.description: Donald Trump says regime change in Iran "would be the best thing that could happen" as a second US aircraft carrier is deployed to the Middle East.

events.title: African Union summit opens as youth anger grows over a 'bloc of old leaders'
events.description: The African Union holds its annual summit in Ethiopia as more young Africans lose faith in the bloc

events.title: Thailandâ€™s ruling conservative party moves closer to forming new coalition government
events.description: Thailandâ€™s Bhumjaithai Party has moved closer to forming a new government after the Pheu Thai Party agreed to join it in a proposed coalition

events.title: Thousands rally in support of Nepal's former king and call for monarchy's return
events.description: Thousands of supporters have gathered outside Kathmandu airport to greet former king Gyanendra Shah and demand Nepal restore the monarchy

events.title: Gaza: Lifesaving aid operations continue despite restrictions
events.description: Humanitarians in the Gaza Strip continue to face impediments in their efforts to deliver lifesaving aid to the population.

events.title: A $10 Walmart gun holster could help identify suspect in Nancy Guthrie case
events.description: The FBI recovered doorbell video showing a masked suspect with a rare $10 Walmart holster during the probe into the abduction of NBC host Savannah Guthrie's 84-year-old mother.

events.title: Ted Bundyâ€™s cousin recalls the chilling moment that exposed the monster within
events.description: Ted Bundy's cousin Edna Martin shares her shocking story in the Oxygen true crime documentary "Love, Ted Bundy," revealing how she discovered the horrifying truth.

events.title: Arizona family sues hospital, says staff â€˜Uberedâ€™ sick son to sidewalk where he died
events.description: An Arizona family alleges hospital staff put their sick son in an Uber and dumped him at a homeless shelter, where he died hours later on a Phoenix sidewalk.

events.title: Fox News True Crime Newsletter: Ransom deadline passes, key evidence emerges in Nancy Guthrie case
events.description: This is a special edition of the Fox News True Crime Newsletter.

events.title: California middle school assistant principal nabbed in child sex sting
events.description: San JosÃ© Police police said a task force arrested multiple people, including a Sunrise Middle School assistant principal, who allegedly sought to have sex with minors.

events.title: Genealogy company exec slams Pima sheriff's 'devastating' move to ship Nancy Guthrie evidence to Florida lab
events.description: DNA testing company Othram slams Pima County Sheriff for sending Nancy Guthrie case evidence to Florida lab instead of FBI, calling decision "devastating."

events.title: Walmart sales records become critical evidence as FBI investigates Nancy Guthrie's disappearance
events.description: Walmart surveillance has become key evidence in Nancy Guthrie's disappearance as investigators use retail data to narrow suspects, expert Jason Pack says.

events.title: Russia murdered Alexei Navalny with deadly frog poison, European countries conclude
events.description: U.K, Sweden, France, Germany and Netherlands say they're "confident" Russia poisoned Alexei Navalny with a lethal toxin from South American poison dart frogs.

events.title: Bolsonaro dynasty eyes comeback as Brazilâ€™s socialist president faces challenge from jailed rivalâ€™s son
events.description: Eduardo Bolsonaro, son of former Brazilian President Jair Bolsonaro, addresses his brother Flavio's recently launched 2026 presidential campaign against President Lula da Silva.

events.title: AOC accuses Israel of genocide in Germany where Holocaust was launched, sparking outrage
events.description: Rep. Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez faces intense criticism after claiming U.S. aid "enabled genocide" in Gaza during controversial Munich speech in Germany on Friday.

events.title: European nation votes to cap population at 10M in major immigration crackdown referendum
events.description: Switzerland will vote June 14 on capping population at 10 million as anti-immigration referendum gains momentum with population nearing 9.1 million.

events.title: Uproar after Iran named vice-chair of UN body promoting democracy, womenâ€™s rights
events.description: Iran's appointment as vice-chair of UN Commission for Social Development faces sharp criticism from human rights advocates and Iranian activists calling it a 'mockery'.

events.title: US forces complete withdrawal from strategic al-Tanf Garrison in Syria
events.description: The U.S. military has completed its withdrawal from al-Tanf Garrison in southern Syria, handing over control to government forces.
